headline: A solid quarter at Best Buy overshadowed by outlook grown cloudy with tariffs
summary: Best Buy posted a solid second quarter that exceeded Wall Street expectations, but the performances was overshadowed by an outlook that has grown cloudy due to tariffs the U.S. is imposing on trading partners.  Despite easily beating expectations, shares slid more than 2% before the opening bell Thursday after the company stuck to earlier guidance for 2025.  The Richfield, Minnesota, company cited the potential impact of tariffs.

The Richfield, Minnesota, company cited the potential impact of tariffs.

headline: Best Buy Stock Falls After Earnings Beat. Why Wall Street’s Disappointed.
summary: Best Buy’s  fiscal second quarter topped Wall Street’s expectations on nearly all fronts, with the electronics retailer notching its strongest same-store sales growth in years.  For the quarter ended Aug. 2, Best Buy reported adjusted earnings of $1.28 a share on $9.44 billion in revenue.  “This better-than-expected sales growth was driven by a mix of new technology innovation, our relentless focus on a seamless omni-channel customer experience and our strong vendor partnerships,” she added.

raw.headline: Best Buy Stock Falls After Earnings Beat. Why Wall Street’s Disappointed.
raw.summary: Best Buy’s  fiscal second quarter topped Wall Street’s expectations on nearly all fronts, with the electronics retailer notching its strongest same-store sales growth in years.  For the quarter ended Aug. 2, Best Buy reported adjusted earnings of $1.28 a share on $9.44 billion in revenue.  “This better-than-expected sales growth was driven by a mix of new technology innovation, our relentless focus on a seamless omni-channel customer experience and our strong vendor partnerships,” she added.

headline: Best Buy (NYSE:BBY) Beats Q2 Sales Expectations
summary: Electronics retailer Best Buy (NYSE:BBY) reported Q2 CY2025 results topping the market’s revenue expectations, with sales up 1.6% year on year to $9.44 billion. The company expects the full year’s revenue to be around $41.5 billion, close to analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.28 per share was 4.5% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

raw.headline: Best Buy (NYSE:BBY) Beats Q2 Sales Expectations
raw.summary: Electronics retailer Best Buy (NYSE:BBY) reported Q2 CY2025 results topping the market’s revenue expectations, with sales up 1.6% year on year to $9.44 billion. The company expects the full year’s revenue to be around $41.5 billion, close to analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.28 per share was 4.5% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Best Buy tops quarterly estimates on Nintendo Switch sales, AI tech demand
summary: (Reuters) -Best Buy topped Wall Street estimates for second-quarter results on Thursday, driven by strong sales of Nintendo Switch gaming consoles and a surge in demand for artificial intelligence-powered computers and mobile phones.  The company, which has struggled with declining sales over the past three years, got a boost from the June launch of the Switch 2, which was heavily pre-ordered at both its physical and online stores.  CEO Corie Barry said the sales momentum continued into August as spending remained resilient, although customers had become more deal-focused and waited for shopping events such as Black Friday and back-to-school promotions.

raw.headline: Best Buy tops quarterly estimates on Nintendo Switch sales, AI tech demand
raw.summary: (Reuters) -Best Buy topped Wall Street estimates for second-quarter results on Thursday, driven by strong sales of Nintendo Switch gaming consoles and a surge in demand for artificial intelligence-powered computers and mobile phones.  The company, which has struggled with declining sales over the past three years, got a boost from the June launch of the Switch 2, which was heavily pre-ordered at both its physical and online stores.  CEO Corie Barry said the sales momentum continued into August as spending remained resilient, although customers had become more deal-focused and waited for shopping events such as Black Friday and back-to-school promotions.

headline: Best Buy: Fiscal Q2 Earnings Snapshot
summary: The average estimate of 12 analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of $1.22 per share. The consumer electronics retailer posted revenue of $9.44 billion in the period, also topping Street forecasts. Ten analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $9.2 billion.

raw.headline: Best Buy: Fiscal Q2 Earnings Snapshot
raw.summary: The average estimate of 12 analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of $1.22 per share. The consumer electronics retailer posted revenue of $9.44 billion in the period, also topping Street forecasts. Ten analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $9.2 billion.
